reviews.review_msg: Laurence is such a sweet woman! She's expressed to me how she is wanting to change the French curriculum here at SFU which is great. She pushes for conveying ideas more than how perfect you can write in French, however syntax and grammar is still important (just 10-20% though). Her lectures are always engaging and always inspiring.

Guillaume is the best teacher you'll ever have. He gives the most amazing and thoughtful feedback on assignments, which is guaranteed to greatly improve your writing skills across just one semester. His comments are always constructive, detailed, and encouraging, helping you grow not just as a student, but as a thinker. He is simply fabulous.
he is such a sweetheart <3 so helpful and so nice, he's an amazing prof
David is without a doubt one of the most valued professors at SFU. He genuinely seeks to improve your understanding of the French language. I wish every professor could follow in his footsteps.

he's like a caring dad that actually wants his students to do well and succeed in life, not just pass the course. he'll give you an easy pass if that's what you're aiming for, but I think his goal of being there is to help you on your way to success.

My assignments added up to a B+ and he gave me a B- meaning he either failed me on the final exam, even though I walked away feeling great about it, or docked marks in places I didn't know about. This was the lowest French mark I've ever gotten and I usually get A's.

Dr. Black was so amazingly funny and passionate! She came out of retirement just to teach our class and you can tell she really cares for her students. She is very accessible outside of class and explains your questions in detail. She is quite picky about grammar and can be a tough grader at times.

Catherine Black is one of the rudest profs I have ever encountered. She has a bias for Native French speakers or Francophone and will put down those who have bad French accents. She made fun of my name and claimed her sarcastic manner is because she is French as a cover up for her rude comments and attitudes towards students. Unclear and difficult

Difficult prof, awesome person! Very sarcastic but in a hilarious way. Really makes you work for it and is very challenging especially for non-native speakers of French. Very accessible outside class hours. Wish we did more writing though that didn't count towards your grade. Had only 3 big things, went over certain expressions most of the time.

Paola is an amazing prof! She's really good at teaching the material, very kind and nice, gives amazing feedback, marks quite leniently even though the material can be a little difficult. Easy course to do well in, plus you'll learn a lot. 5/5, strongly recommend taking FREN 301W with her if possible
I have taken 4 classes with her and she is the best professor you'll ever have!! Huge sweetheart. Highly reccomend!!!

I have taken a few classes with Paola now and I can say she is the best prof in the French dept. She genuinely cares about her students and wants to see us succeed. You have to go to class because participation matters a lot but it is worthwhile because she makes lectures engaging with group work and opportunities to practice before being graded.
her classes were a bit boring, but she's a friendly, nice and easy-going prof. she's helpful if you're having difficulties (finding ideas) when writing your papers. her marking was fair.
She is a very kind and compassionate teacher. Her classes are a little boring but she tries very hard. She is a good teacher, and a fair marker. She is very understanding. Good.

Sometimes Rocky does not speak very clearly, but overall he has a great teaching style.  He provides excellent and thorough feedback.  I really enjoyed the 301 class because there was room for some creative writing.  He is a fun guy, and I look forward to taking more of his classes next Spring.
Easy, friendly attitude, kind of funny. Takes attendance so show up. Take his 301 class if you can!
She's a really kind prof and a good listener.

Definitely not a favourite of mine. She's really vague with her instructions. She gets due dates mixed up and then gets annoyed when people don't hand in the work on time. I honestly didn't learn very much. You can get away with skipping as long as you do the work. She gives good feedback; that's the only good thing about her.

My absolute favourite French prof at SFU! She's very understanding and available for meetings even outside her office hours, responds to emails quickly. Her classes are mainly lecture style, but she keeps it interesting. She can be a bit vague with her assignment outlines, so if you're confused make sure to ask for help.
She Sucks! Frustrated, arrogant, impolite, confused, hard marker. Never available for help.Avoid her!

She constantly has to maintain an air of superiority over her students. Her instructions are confusing and her helpfulness clarifying is weak(her way or the highway). She is nice enough, but you may not get anything out of her classes. I strongly discourage taking her any of her classes.
I think I took the same class with he person below me, yes I 100% agree with the person below me.... I never got an F ever in my life and she gave me an F.....

It was a very difficult class for me. You can't study for her class. If you are from immersion that spell and know grammar well, you'll do well in her class. Not for people with "minimum" experience with French as a language.
